repo.description: The most widely used Python to C compiler
repo.name: cython

body:
closes #4736
Initial commits to build wheels and sdist on cibuildwheel.
Only Python > 3.6 is supported with this(hopefully that is also the case for Cython 3.1).

comment_data.body:
v2.5.0 is the most recent tag
```suggestion
        uses: pypa/cibuildwheel@v2.5.0
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,97 @@
+# Workflow to build wheels for upload to PyPI.
+# While this workflow is not active right now,
+# it will be used for Cython 3.1 after Python 2.7
+# support is dropped.
+name: Wheel Builder
+on:
+  schedule:
+  #        ┌───────────── minute (0 - 59)
+  #        │  ┌───────────── hour (0 - 23)
+  #        │  │ ┌───────────── day of the month (1 - 31)
+  #        │  │ │ ┌───────────── month (1 - 12 or JAN-DEC)
+  #        │  │ │ │ ┌───────────── day of the week (0 - 6 or SUN-SAT)
+  #        │  │ │ │ │
+  - cron: "42 1 * * 4"
+  push:
+    branches:
+      - master
+  pull_request:
+    branches:
+      - master
+  workflow_dispatch:
+
+concurrency:
+  group: ${{ github.workflow }}-${{ github.head_ref || github.run_id }}
+  cancel-in-progress: true
+
+jobs:
+  build_wheels:
+    name: Build wheel for ${{ matrix.python }}-${{ matrix.buildplat[1] }}
+    runs-on: ${{ matrix.buildplat[0] }}
+    strategy:
+      # Ensure that a wheel builder finishes even if another fails
+      fail-fast: false
+      matrix:
+        # Github Actions doesn't support pairing matrix values together, let's improvise
+        # https://github.com/github/feedback/discussions/7835#discussioncomment-1769026
+        buildplat:
+        - [ubuntu-20.04, manylinux_x86_64]
+        - [ubuntu-20.04, musllinux_x86_64]
+        - [macos-10.15, macosx_*]
+        - [windows-2019, win_amd64]
+        - [windows-2019, win32]
+        python: ["cp36", "cp37", "cp38", "cp39", "cp310"] # Note: Wheels not needed for PyPy
+    steps:
+      - name: Checkout Cython
+        uses: actions/checkout@v3
+        with:
+          submodules: true
+          # versioneer.py requires the latest tag to be reachable. Here we
+          # fetch the complete history to get access to the tags.
+          # A shallow clone can work when the following issue is resolved:
+          # https://github.com/actions/checkout/issues/338
+          fetch-depth: 0
+      
+      - name: Build wheels
+        uses: pypa/cibuildwheel@v2.4.0

comment_data.body: Let's use the most recent environments, using `-latest` (`ubuntu-latest`, etc.)
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,97 @@

comment_data.body: Do we really want to build wheels every push and PR to master?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,97 @@
+# Workflow to build wheels for upload to PyPI.
+# While this workflow is not active right now,
+# it will be used for Cython 3.1 after Python 2.7
+# support is dropped.
+name: Wheel Builder
+on:
+  schedule:

comment_data.body:
Calling setup.py directly is depreciated, I would switch to using pypa's [build](https://github.com/pypa/build) tool for wheel and sdist building.

See https://blog.ganssle.io/articles/2021/10/setup-py-deprecated.html for reasoning and https://pypa-build.readthedocs.io/en/stable/ for build documentation.

```suggestion
      - run: pip install --upgrade build wheel setuptools
      - run: python -m build --sdist
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,97 @@
+# Workflow to build wheels for upload to PyPI.
+# While this workflow is not active right now,
+# it will be used for Cython 3.1 after Python 2.7
+# support is dropped.
+name: Wheel Builder
+on:
+  schedule:
+  #        ┌───────────── minute (0 - 59)
+  #        │  ┌───────────── hour (0 - 23)
+  #        │  │ ┌───────────── day of the month (1 - 31)
+  #        │  │ │ ┌───────────── month (1 - 12 or JAN-DEC)
+  #        │  │ │ │ ┌───────────── day of the week (0 - 6 or SUN-SAT)
+  #        │  │ │ │ │
+  - cron: "42 1 * * 4"
+  push:
+    branches:
+      - master
+  pull_request:
+    branches:
+      - master
+  workflow_dispatch:
+
+concurrency:
+  group: ${{ github.workflow }}-${{ github.head_ref || github.run_id }}
+  cancel-in-progress: true
+
+jobs:
+  build_wheels:
+    name: Build wheel for ${{ matrix.python }}-${{ matrix.buildplat[1] }}
+    runs-on: ${{ matrix.buildplat[0] }}
+    strategy:
+      # Ensure that a wheel builder finishes even if another fails
+      fail-fast: false
+      matrix:
+        # Github Actions doesn't support pairing matrix values together, let's improvise
+        # https://github.com/github/feedback/discussions/7835#discussioncomment-1769026
+        buildplat:
+        - [ubuntu-20.04, manylinux_x86_64]
+        - [ubuntu-20.04, musllinux_x86_64]
+        - [macos-10.15, macosx_*]
+        - [windows-2019, win_amd64]
+        - [windows-2019, win32]
+        python: ["cp36", "cp37", "cp38", "cp39", "cp310"] # Note: Wheels not needed for PyPy
+    steps:
+      - name: Checkout Cython
+        uses: actions/checkout@v3
+        with:
+          submodules: true
+          # versioneer.py requires the latest tag to be reachable. Here we
+          # fetch the complete history to get access to the tags.
+          # A shallow clone can work when the following issue is resolved:
+          # https://github.com/actions/checkout/issues/338
+          fetch-depth: 0
+      
+      - name: Build wheels
+        uses: pypa/cibuildwheel@v2.4.0
+        env:
+          # TODO: Build Cython with the compile-all flag?
+          # Unfortunately, there is no way to modify cibuildwheel's build command
+          # so there is no way to pass this in directly.
+          # This would require modifying cython's setup.py to look for these flags
+          # in env vars.
+          CIBW_BUILD: ${{ matrix.python }}-${{ matrix.buildplat[1] }}
+          CIBW_ENVIRONMENT: CFLAGS='-O3 -g0 -mtune=generic -pipe -fPIC' LDFLAGS='-fPIC'
+          # TODO: Cython tests take a long time to complete
+          # consider running a subset in the future?
+          #CIBW_TEST_COMMAND: python {project}/runtests.py -vv --no-refnanny
+
+      - uses: actions/upload-artifact@v3
+        with:
+          name: ${{ matrix.python }}-${{ startsWith(matrix.buildplat[1], 'macosx') && 'macosx' || matrix.buildplat[1] }}
+          path: ./wheelhouse/*.whl
+  build_sdist:
+    name: Build sdist
+    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
+    steps:
+      - name: Checkout Cython
+        uses: actions/checkout@v3
+        with:
+          submodules: true
+          # versioneer.py requires the latest tag to be reachable. Here we
+          # fetch the complete history to get access to the tags.
+          # A shallow clone can work when the following issue is resolved:
+          # https://github.com/actions/checkout/issues/338
+          fetch-depth: 0
+      # Used to push the built wheels
+      - uses: actions/setup-python@v3
+        with:
+          # Build sdist on lowest supported Python
+          python-version: '3.6'
+      - name: Build sdist
+        run: |
+          python setup.py sdist

comment_data.body: Currently, wheel building is a release-only workflow. I think we can keep it that way.

@@ -0,0 +1,97 @@

+# it will be used for Cython 3.1 after Python 2.7
+# support is dropped.
+name: Wheel Builder
+on:
+  schedule:

comment_data.body: Should be ok, yes. The Linux wheel builds all use Docker, so C compilers etc. aren't an issue for this. Latest should be fine.

comment_data.body: That would be 2.7, but I think we built our sdists on some not-so-old Python 3.x for quite a while now.

comment_data.body: I'd honestly prefer to pin to stay consistent with Windows and MacOS. Windows and MacOS do not use docker IIRC, and so should be pinned.

comment_data.body:
Hm. Cython doesn't have a pyproject.toml file yet. I would wait until we have that available. 
It looks like build will just execute setup.py under the hood, which is equivalent to what we're doing now without it.
I'd like to remain explicit about the setup.py usage until we get a pyproject.toml.
comment_data.diff_hunk:

comment_data.body: Yeah, I was thinking in terms of post 3.0 when we wouldn't have to worry about Python 2.7. Are you planning to use the sdist part of this for 3.0? I can update this in that case.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,97 @@
+# Workflow to build wheels for upload to PyPI.
+# While this workflow is not active right now,
+# it will be used for Cython 3.1 after Python 2.7
+# support is dropped.
+name: Wheel Builder
+on:
+  schedule:
+  #        ┌───────────── minute (0 - 59)
+  #        │  ┌───────────── hour (0 - 23)
+  #        │  │ ┌───────────── day of the month (1 - 31)
+  #        │  │ │ ┌───────────── month (1 - 12 or JAN-DEC)
+  #        │  │ │ │ ┌───────────── day of the week (0 - 6 or SUN-SAT)
+  #        │  │ │ │ │
+  - cron: "42 1 * * 4"
+  push:
+    branches:
+      - master
+  pull_request:
+    branches:
+      - master
+  workflow_dispatch:
+
+concurrency:
+  group: ${{ github.workflow }}-${{ github.head_ref || github.run_id }}
+  cancel-in-progress: true
+
+jobs:
+  build_wheels:
+    name: Build wheel for ${{ matrix.python }}-${{ matrix.buildplat[1] }}
+    runs-on: ${{ matrix.buildplat[0] }}
+    strategy:
+      # Ensure that a wheel builder finishes even if another fails
+      fail-fast: false
+      matrix:
+        # Github Actions doesn't support pairing matrix values together, let's improvise
+        # https://github.com/github/feedback/discussions/7835#discussioncomment-1769026
+        buildplat:
+        - [ubuntu-20.04, manylinux_x86_64]
+        - [ubuntu-20.04, musllinux_x86_64]
+        - [macos-10.15, macosx_*]
+        - [windows-2019, win_amd64]
+        - [windows-2019, win32]
+        python: ["cp36", "cp37", "cp38", "cp39", "cp310"] # Note: Wheels not needed for PyPy
+    steps:
+      - name: Checkout Cython
+        uses: actions/checkout@v3
+        with:
+          submodules: true
+          # versioneer.py requires the latest tag to be reachable. Here we
+          # fetch the complete history to get access to the tags.
+          # A shallow clone can work when the following issue is resolved:
+          # https://github.com/actions/checkout/issues/338
+          fetch-depth: 0
+      
+      - name: Build wheels
+        uses: pypa/cibuildwheel@v2.4.0
+        env:
+          # TODO: Build Cython with the compile-all flag?
+          # Unfortunately, there is no way to modify cibuildwheel's build command
+          # so there is no way to pass this in directly.
+          # This would require modifying cython's setup.py to look for these flags
+          # in env vars.
+          CIBW_BUILD: ${{ matrix.python }}-${{ matrix.buildplat[1] }}
+          CIBW_ENVIRONMENT: CFLAGS='-O3 -g0 -mtune=generic -pipe -fPIC' LDFLAGS='-fPIC'
+          # TODO: Cython tests take a long time to complete
+          # consider running a subset in the future?
+          #CIBW_TEST_COMMAND: python {project}/runtests.py -vv --no-refnanny
+
+      - uses: actions/upload-artifact@v3
+        with:
+          name: ${{ matrix.python }}-${{ startsWith(matrix.buildplat[1], 'macosx') && 'macosx' || matrix.buildplat[1] }}
+          path: ./wheelhouse/*.whl
+  build_sdist:
+    name: Build sdist
+    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
+    steps:
+      - name: Checkout Cython
+        uses: actions/checkout@v3
+        with:
+          submodules: true
+          # versioneer.py requires the latest tag to be reachable. Here we
+          # fetch the complete history to get access to the tags.
+          # A shallow clone can work when the following issue is resolved:
+          # https://github.com/actions/checkout/issues/338
+          fetch-depth: 0
+      # Used to push the built wheels
+      - uses: actions/setup-python@v3
+        with:
+          # Build sdist on lowest supported Python

comment_data.body:
I would advocate for a weekly build in addition to working on release. From my work on the wheels for numpy/pandas, these things tend to break from time to time. 

In numpy in particular, we also can trigger builds using a label or a certain commit message, to run the wheel builder CI when a PR changes the build config. If Cython wants this, I can also port this over too.

+# While this workflow is not active right now,
+# it will be used for Cython 3.1 after Python 2.7
+# support is dropped.
+name: Wheel Builder
+on:
+  schedule:
